title: If only Solo Que was actually random?
body:
But its not is it? If you win a few games in a row, it starts matching you with players who've lost a few in a row, doesn't it?

Instead of just random teammates around the same rank, they purposely built in these swings of wins and losses. 

So instead of being matched with random and going WIN WIN LOSS WIN LOSS WIN WIN LOSS it always seemes to go WIN WIN WIN WIN WIN LOSS LOSS LOSS LOSS WIN WIN WIN LOSS LOSS LOSS WIN WIN WIN WIN.

Its like Riot just HAD to make it as annoying as possible.

replies.body:
Mmr is too sensitive.
It does swing too quickly to make win/loss streaks to keep everyone close to 50% instead of letting the law of large numbers make it happen. Their system is good for plat skill player to dominate a bunch of games and make it to plat, but it's terrible for gold 3 skill player to climb past gold 5 if they get stuck there by their win streaks gaining 100 lp and their loss streaks happening during promotionals
Right. Except, I believe that Riot doesn't tell us everything. I honestly believe they are a shady ass company.
Riot doesnt do anything they just set the MMR train agoing and walk away. the MMR matches you with similar ranked players and away you go.
Thats what they say. How do we know really?
Sorry but I don't believe that.
No, it doesn't work like that.
